projectGridLines.title: Understanding waste management among the Indian Himalayan communities
projectGridLines.description:
Host Organization: J-PAL & Waste Warriors Society

Description: 

The waste management data in the Indian Himalayan Region (a predominantly rural area) is lax, as the government institutions claim it to be zero (given households and commercial establishments opt to either dump in monsoon rivulets, forests, or mountain ecosystems or burn it in the open. This creates a problem in setting up the intervention for curbing the environmentally harmful practices that aggravate climate change and create a social divide. The project will involve analyzing a variety of data collected by Waste Warriors and triangulating it with comprehensive secondary research on policy review and behavioral change frameworks to inform potential global warming mitigation in IHR through waste management. 


Skill sets: 

  • Data collection, analysis, and reporting 
  • Familiarity with open-source GIS/satellite mapping tools 
  • Know-how of primary research tools
  • Proficiency with R, Python, or any other statistical programming languages 
  • Well-versed with data cleaning, sorting, and reporting tools like Excel, Tableau, SQL, etc



Traits expectation: 

  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 
  • Good verbal, written, and presentation skills


Expected learning: 

  • Designing primary data collection tools for specific communities
  • Gain skills in evaluating social programs
  • Applying GIS tools and working with a variety of climate, health, and socioeconomic datasets
  • Improved domain understanding of climate change, WASH, and health


Specific courses required for project execution:

  • Any advanced statistics/data science course
